channel.title: Req: a tutorial how to install Xubuntu
channel.description:
Well im brand new to linux, and i go to [url=http://www.xubuntu.org/]http://www.xubuntu.org/[/url] and then i click [url=http://www.xubuntu.org/get] Click here to get Xubuntu[/url] Then i click on [url=http://mirror.anl.gov/pub/ubuntu-iso/DVDs/xubuntu/]U.S[/url]
Now i went to [url=http://mirror.anl.gov/pub/ubuntu-iso/DVDs/xubuntu/edgy/release/]edgy edf[/url] and downloaded the first one.
I have written the files to a cd. I brong th e cd the to the comp i'm installing on (the one im installing on sucks at internet connection) and i open the linux think and i click on install and my comp cant reginoaze it. What do i do?
Did i do this right?
[b][u][size=20pt]Do not bump this thread, i figured it out!!![/size][/u][/b]

item.title: Req: a tutorial how to install Xubuntu
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:11, topic:70266”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=103204.msg1042336#msg1042336 date=1174706262]

if you need a tutorial for linux you def shouldnt use it at all

My comp cant read the files and i saved the files to a disk and the folder is called “linux” on the cd
[/quote]

LOL> I ROFL’ED>

You don’t drag and drop the files onto the cd! You download the iso, and download DVD Decrypter. Open DVD Decrypter, and go to Mode>ISO>Write. For the ‘source’ put the xubuntu iso you downloaded, and click the button to burn :D[/quote]
Thank you, i understand now… KK no none post any more i get it…

Read full topic
item.source: Req: a tutorial how to install Xubuntu

item.title: Req: a tutorial how to install Xubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“fellixombc, post:4, topic:70266”][quote author=lawl link=topic=103204.msg1042223#msg1042223 date=1174704875]
if you need a tutorial for linux you def shouldnt use it at all
[/quote]
My comp cant read the files and i saved the files to a disk and the folder is called “linux” on the cd[/quote]

LOL> I ROFL’ED>

You don’t drag and drop the files onto the cd! You download the iso, and download DVD Decrypter. Open DVD Decrypter, and go to Mode>ISO>Write. For the ‘source’ put the xubuntu iso you downloaded, and click the button to burn

Read full topic

item.title: Req: a tutorial how to install Xubuntu
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:9, topic:70266”][quote author=lawl link=topic=103204.msg1042223#msg1042223 date=1174704875]
if you need a tutorial for linux you def shouldnt use it at all
[/quote]
No, anyone needs a tutorial their first time using Linux. He just wants to try Linux and needs a little help.

I’ve been there, and I guarantee you have too.[/quote]
Thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: Req: a tutorial how to install Xubuntu
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“SatanClaus, post:5, topic:70266”][quote author=lawl link=topic=103204.msg1042223#msg1042223 date=1174704875]
if you need a tutorial for linux you def shouldnt use it at all
[/quote]

^Agreed. Linux can be easily “broken,” you can’t mess around with it like you can with Windows…if you don’t know what you’re talking about, stay with windows, or ask an adult to help you that knows about linux.[/quote]
Yes, thats what im doing, getting my private teacher to help me.

Read full topic

item.source: Req: a tutorial how to install Xubuntu

item.title: Req: a tutorial how to install Xubuntu
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“ghostboy195, post:2, topic:70266”]it depends on what type of computer you plan on installing it on. most likely yes, you did it right, but if the computer you plan on installing it on is a mac or a 64bit computer then you should have downloaded the other ones. Now all you need to do is burn it to a CD. I recommend using a program called CD Burner XP Pro 3. It is free and easy to use. You can dl it here
First insert a cd into your cd burner. Then open up CD Burner XP Pro 3. Click the first option in the box that pops up in the program. The option should say, “Click Here to… Create a new Data-CD/RW, Data-DVD/RW, Video-DVD or create and/or burn an ISO image. You can also erase a disc or convert an ISO image.”
Then Click on File, wright disc from ISO File. Then in the new window that pops up, click the button that says … and find the location of your iso file. Then select your writing speed and click Write Disc. Wait for the disc to finish its burning and then you’re DONE!!![/quote]
Windows let me write the files to the disk without the burn pro thing…

WTH… It wont let me install it

Read full topic
item.source: Req: a tutorial how to install Xubuntu

item.title: Req: a tutorial how to install Xubuntu
item.dc:creator: @ghostboy195 ghostboy195
item.description:
@ghostboy195 wrote:

it depends on what type of computer you plan on installing it on. most likely yes, you did it right, but if the computer you plan on installing it on is a mac or a 64bit computer then you should have downloaded the other ones. Now all you need to do is burn it to a CD. I recommend using a program called CD Burner XP Pro 3. It is free and easy to use. You can dl it here
First insert a cd into your cd burner. Then open up CD Burner XP Pro 3. Click the first option in the box that pops up in the program. The option should say, “Click Here to… Create a new Data-CD/RW, Data-DVD/RW, Video-DVD or create and/or burn an ISO image. You can also erase a disc or convert an ISO image.”
Then Click on File, wright disc from ISO File. Then in the new window that pops up, click the button that says … and find the location of your iso file. Then select your writing speed and click Write Disc. Wait for the disc to finish its burning and then you’re DONE!!!

Read full topic
